text:
Hey All, I’m a super newb with very basic HTML/CSS knowledge. I’m working on teaching myself to build custom modules for our site in HubSpot. My first exercise is to take something from CodePen and put it into the designer. I’ve done this pretty well, but I can’t figure out how to create the option for styling the various elements. <https://codepen.io/mpone/pen/PoYdzGd>

Would love some tips on what to do
What do you mean by styles elements? Wouldn't you just use CSS?
I’d want to give the person who is working with the module while building pages the ability to, for example, change the color of the background, the font size and color, etc…

Ahh. Well you would setup fields for everything you want to be editable, so a number field for font size, color field for background, etc.  

Then use HubL in the module HTML. There a section here in how to style a module based on module fields.  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files>
I see. This is going to really stretch my abilities, but I’m sure I can get this.
:+1: reach out if you any assistance
Lol, I just might take you up on that offer :slightly_smiling_face: Would love to pick your brain some time after the long weekend
I think I’m a relatively simple use-case
Yeah for sure. Feel free to DM me sometime next week
